availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Thomas A. Leeper (Livingston County, Kentucky, farmer and jailer.)

body.p: Livingston County, Kentucky, farmer and jailer. Kentucky native. Married to Margaret Jarrett Leeper in Livingston County, Kentucky, on December 27, 1852. Father of John G. Leeper, Elizabeth J. Leeper, Harman King Leeper, Margaret L. Leeper, and Frederick Leeper. Farmer in Livingston County, Kentucky, in 1850. Jailer in Livingston County in 1860. Owned one enslaved person in Livingston County in 1860.

ab.bibl:

Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Livingston County, Smithland Precinct, p. 238B.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll 994045, Livingston County Births.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll 994045, Livingston County Deaths.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll 994045, Livingston County Marriages.
